definition: to part one's hair in the middle
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: The paper put forward all translation skills on noun clauses one by one.
sentences.chinese: 篇中分层次地论述了各种名词从句的翻译方法和技巧。

sentences.english: Joe Aguirre, wavy hair the color of cigarette ash and parted down the middle, gave them his point of view.
sentences.chinese: 乔留着一头中分的烟灰色波浪发，在给他俩面授机宜。

definition: level with one's shoulders/(of two people) both the same height
(men) sideburns/(women) lengths of hair that hang down over the temples
Mawei district of Fuzhou city 福州市[Fu2 zhou1 shi4], Fujian
ponytail (hairstyle)/horse's tail/slender fibers like horse's tail (applies to various plants)
